lead_paragraph: American actors have often profited from doing television commercials abroad, but one such spot promoting tourism in the coastal Marche region of Italy, scheduled to begin broadcasting in early January, has thrust Dustin Hoffman into an unexpected controversy. The two-time Oscar winner is being criticized for "butchering" the Italian language in his recitation of "L'Infinito," a poem by the 19th-century Italian writer Giacomo Leopardi, a native of Marche, which lies on the Adriatic between Rome and Bologna.
